Key Match Events: The Raptors rolled the Wizards to the tune of a 125-98 win, opening up a massive lead in the game’s opening minutes and never relenting from there.
RJ Barrett scored 17 points in 14 minutes, hitting a trio of threes and generally being a terror attacking the paint.
Jamal Shead had a strong stint in the first quarter, and the team mimicked his movements to get free for a late-clock bucket.
Post-Match Reflections: The Raptors looked superior, but it's not particularly meaningful given they were playing a rebuilding Wizards team without Malcolm Brogdon.
The team is really pulling for Ulrich Chomche, and it's clear everyone is taking the right view – the long view – with the development plan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A moment of silence was held for Dikembe Mutombo prior to tipoff.
Aaliyah Edwards, Natalie Achonwa, Jerome Williams, and Vince Carter were in attendance, after participating in some NBA Canada activations and community events throughout the weekend.
Canada hockey’s royal newlyweds, Laura Stacey and Marie-Philip Poulin, were also at the game.
Others: The Raptors will play the defending champion Boston Celtics twice in exhibition action later this month.
The team has until Oct. 31 to exercise team options on the rookie-scale contracts of Gradey Dick and Ochai Agbaji.
The team also has until Oct. 21 to work out a contract extension with Davion Mitchell.
